title: Calling `.into()` on argument that expects `Into<Type>` gives confusing error

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

labels.name: D-confusing
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error that should be reworked

labels.name: D-papercut
labels.description: Diagnostic error that needs small tweaks

labels.name: D-newcomer-roadblock
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error hard to understand for new users

body:
When calling `(x: Type)::into()` in a fn that expects `Into<Type>` we currently emit:

```
error[E0283]: type annotations needed
    --> src/librustc_resolve/late/diagnostics.rs:1143:21
     |
1143 |                 err.span_note(spans.into(), "these named lifetimes are available to use");
     |                     ^^^^^^^^^ ------------ this method call resolves to `T`
     |                     |
     |                     cannot infer type for type parameter `S` declared on the method `span_note`
     |
     = note: cannot resolve `_: std::convert::Into<rustc_span::MultiSpan>`
```

We should check whether `T == MultiSpan` and suggest the removal of the `into()` call.
